Modeling Building Elements - Exercise 2

Learn Revit > Module 1 > Exercise 2

Adding Doors and Windows

In this exercise, you will add doors and window openings to the same house in the previous exercise using Autodesk Revit.

Objectives:

  • Add doors and windows to a building model by choosing their type and placing

    components in host walls.

  • Change door and window placement.

  • Change door and window height properties.

Place exterior doors

  1. Download the start file here.

  2. Open the Ground Floor plan view.

  3. On the Architecture tab, click Door.

  4. In Properties Palette, select Double-Glass 48” x 102” door type.

    {

  5. Place Double-Glass 48” x 102” door type at each location where Type B is identified in the Ground Floor plan view.

    a. Hover cursor over Revit wall and use CAD underlay as a reference > guide for handing and swing direction

    b. Left click to place door

    *Note: Doors are hosted elements, you must hover over the edge
of a Revit wall in order to preview the door to be placed.*

*To change the handing of single doors prior to placement use
the space bar key.*

  6. In Properties Palette, select Single-Glass 24” x 102” door type and place at each location where Type B is identified in the Ground Floor plan view.

Note: To change the handing of single doors prior to placement use the space bar key.

Place interior doors

  1. On the Architecture tab, click Door.

  2. In Properties Palette, select Single-Flush 20” x 84” door type and place at each location where Type A is identified in the Ground Floor plan view.

    a. Hover cursor over Revit wall and use CAD underlay as a reference guide for handing and swing direction

    b. Left click to place door

    *Note: Doors are hosted elements, you must hover over the edge
of a Revit wall in order to preview the door to be placed.*

*To change the handing of single doors prior to placement use
the space bar key.*

  3. In Properties Palette, select Single-Flush 24” x 84” door type and place at each location where Type B is identified in the Ground Floor plan view.

  4. In Properties Palette, select Double-Flush 40” x 84” door type and place at each location where Type C is identified in the Ground Floor plan view.

Place exterior windows

  1. On the Architecture tab, click Window.

  2. In Properties Palette, select Casement with Trim 24” x 24” window type.

  3. Place Casement with Trim 24” x 24”window type at each location where Type A is identified in the Ground Floor plan view.

    a. Hover cursor over the exterior face of the Revit wall and use > CAD underlay as a reference guide

    b. Left click to place window

    *Note: Windows are hosted elements, you must hover over the edge
of a Revit wall in order to preview the window to be placed.*

*Hovering the cursor over the outside face of the Revit wall
ensures the correct orientation of the Revit window.*

  4. In Properties Palette, select Fixed with Trim 44” x 24” window type and place at each location where Type B is identified in the Ground Floor plan view.

  5. In Properties Palette, select Casement with Trim 24” x 48” window type and place at each location where Type C is identified in the Ground Floor plan view.

  6. In Properties Palette, select Fixed with Trim 44” x 48” window type and place at each location where Type D is identified in the Ground Floor plan view.

  7. Hit ESC key twice to end the window command

Change window head height

  1. Open the {3D} 3D view.

  2. Orbit the model to see the model of the exterior windows just placed.

    Note: Use the ViewCube or hold down Shift key + hold down middle mouse button and drag the mouse in direction desired.

  3. Focus on the Type A windows in the upper right corner of the plan view.

  4. Place both Type A windows in a common selection set. Holding down the CTRL key, left click on each window to place them in a common selection set.

  5. In Properties palette, change the Head Height value to: 7’-0” (2.123m)

    a. Click APPLY to accept and apply changes to the model elements.

  6. Repeat steps 3 through 5 for window types: Type B, Type C, and Type D separately.

  7. Save the Revit file as: Module01Ex02_Finished.rvt and hand in.

This concludes Exercise 2.
